channel.title: AOL Agile User Story & Bug Tracking
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of some issues

item.title: [LLU-4211] Fens "Unhandled Exception Occurred" failure
item.description:
Occasionsally, we get a fens_response of "Unhandled Exception Occurred" written to the provision_record within IMS. Now this appears to happen to all order action types (i.e. build, modify & delete). Further investigation needs to be undertaken to identify the reason for this - i.e. is it a valid response from FENS, or is it something the LLU code is writing to this table.
 
However, the implications of this could be a problem. For example, in the situation where BBMS sends us a modify order (where the member wants to move to a new product - e.g. a Max product), even though IMS is updated to reflect this, the failed response from FENS results in a MODIFY_FAILED record being inserted into the bbmsStatusUpdate table.

If this fens_response message is actually generated by FENS, then we need to re-send this provision_request rather than treating it as a failure. If it is an internal LLU message, we need to prevent this from happening. When records have been datafixed to be re-sent, they appear to complete successfully! It may be prudent to put some max number of re-tries logic for this.

item.title: [LLU-4216] Update Weblogic Config changes
item.description:
All
 
Can we please have JIRAs raised to make erssential config changes to the build files for Weblogic in BBMS, Talk and LLU. These changes are to enable our NMS to start monitroing key metrics within Weblogic and enable us to get early warning of potential Sev 1 incidents in prod. These changes DO NOT need to be made in any other Weblogic build environments.
 
1: SNMP port configured to use 181 (blue) and 191 (green)
2: Community prefix set to : lux-uksysops
3: Trap Destination changed: Host = 10.155.121.46 Community = lux-uksysops
 
Once these changes are in place we can be sure monitroing will persist after cutovers and I will write the relevant probes. Please send me the JIRA references and advise on when they are complete.
 
Phil H
